newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan machine-tool sector bullish -- Merrill Lynch.
newsitem.headline: Japan machine-tool sector bullish -- Merrill Lynch.

text.p: Merrill Lynch Japan Inc strategist Keiko Kondo said on Wednesday she is bullish towards Japan's machine-tool sector, which has benefited from the weaker yen.
She raised her investment recommendation from "market weight" to "overweight," and her investment allocation ratio for a model portfolio from 0.3 percent to 1.0 percent.

"The weaker yen improves the machine-tool sector's international competitiveness," Kondo said. She also said that price-to-earnings ratios and other valuations on issues in the sector indicated current prices were relatively cheap.
She said she and other strategists and analysts at Merrill Lynch had bullish forecasts for Makino Milling Machine Co Ltd.
The company's shares finished Wednesday's morning session at 867 yen, down 17 from Tuesday.
